result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel M Montemayor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation on case 2014CF001115.

With Huber. Release for standard conditions. Release for child care is authorized by the court as long as Agent deems appropriate.  Consecutive to 14CF1115.  Sentence credit of 198 days were granted.
Consecutive to: Case 14CF1115

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel M Montemayor in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven R. Kohn.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State makes sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kohn makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

8  MONTHS HUBER (CREDIT - 198 days)     **CONSECUTIVE TO 14CF1115**

COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Filed.
Sentencing hearing on February 5, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Daniel M Montemayor in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven R. Kohn.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Kohn requests a presentence investigation.  Court orders a presentence investigation and sets case over for sentencing.  Court revokes bail.  Defendant to be held in custody until sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Daniel M Montemayor in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven R. Kohn.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kohn requests a plea and sentence date.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on November 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.
filed by Attorney Steven Kohn

Atty Kohn has been retained by the defendant.
Hearing on September 8, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 09:00 am.
